tourName: Naadam festival & Gobi desert tour, Mongolia
generalInfo:
A celebration of tradition, community, and the vast open landscapes that define Mongolia, this small-group journey offers a grounded introduction to the realities of contemporary life — going beyond familiar stereotypes.

Combining Naadam with time in Ulaanbaatar (Mongolia's capital city), the Gobi Desert, and the central heartland, you’ll experience Mongolia as it is today: the energy of the capital, small-town life, centuries-old monasteries, protected landscapes, and insight into rural livelihoods through ger stays with communities we have worked alongside for many years.

Designed for curious travellers seeking a thoughtful introduction to Mongolia, this journey lays the foundations for deeper understanding, connection, and respect for a country shaped as much by change as by tradition.

We are a small, Mongolian-registered company & intentionally limit our scale to fewer than 200 bookings per year. Responsible tourism shapes how our trips are planned & delivered, rather than sitting alongside them.

Our approach prioritises long-term relationships & meaningful employment. We invest directly in our own operations & in intergenerational, gender-mixed teams, including a free training programme for Mongolian women seeking to work in tourism. All of our trip assistants are Mongolian women, bringing local knowledge, lived experience, & perspective to each journey. Our drivers & trip assistants are employed year-round, providing stable income that supports extended families.

Every itinerary we run is designed to strengthen skills within our team while ensuring tangible, lasting benefits for the communities we partner with. This forms part of what we call our bigger travel philosophy — one that you as our guest becomes part of simply by joining the journey.

Who This Experience Is For

This journey suits curious, open-minded travellers — whether travelling solo, as a couple, or with friends — who value relationships, context, and everyday life, & who appreciate small group sizes (a maximum of six) for a more genuine experience. Accommodation is simple & shared, travel days can be long — a natural part of moving through a vast country with limited infrastructure — and plans may shift in response to weather and local conditions.

You don’t need to be especially fit, but you should have a flexible mindset & be comfortable walking on uneven ground, spending extended time outdoors, and managing cold conditions with appropriate layers. Daily life involves getting in and out of vehicles, using outdoor toilets, and sharing space with others.

Accessibility considerations

Our small-group journeys are designed around seasonal conditions, rural infrastructure, and traditional celebrations. Depending on your access needs, this experience may or may not be suitable. We encourage you to get in touch with any specific questions so we can advise openly.

dayInfo.description: Final Arrival Day "Intro To Ulaanbaatar' Welcome to Mongolia! Enjoy a free transfer from the airport to your chosen accommodation. Join us for an informal introduction to Mongolia’s capital through local eyes, a local-style lunch, and a welcome drink'
Gobi Desert - Baga Gazriin Chuluu Rock Formations Travel through the vast open steppe to the dramatic and sacred granite formations of Baga Gazriin Chuluu.

Dalanzadgad & Gobi Museum of Nature and History Arrive in the provincial capital of the South Gobi. Visit the Gobi Museum of Nature and History for insight into the region’s prehistoric past, then visit the locally run Gobi Burd tree-planting project. En-route, stop at the ancient formations of Tsagaan Suvraga - White Stupa.

Yolyn Am & Gobi Gurvan Saikhan National Park Khongoryn Els sand dunes Explore the dramatic Yolyn Am Canyon, nestled within the Gobi Gurvan Saikhan National Park, before heading west to the towering dunes of Khongoryn Els.

Bayanzag | The Flaming Cliffs Visit the red sandstone landscapes of Bayanzag, known worldwide as the Flaming Cliffs, where the first dinosaur eggs were discovered—one of the Gobi’s most iconic sights.
Erdenedalai herders homestay Travel north into the wide, open landscapes of the Middle Gobi and the rural community of Erdenedalai, where you’ll be hosted by the Nergui herding family.

Central Heartland - Khogno Khan Nature Reserve & Elsen Tasarkhai sand dunes: Drive to and explore the striking contrasts of this sacred granite mountain, where open steppe meets golden sand dunes. Walk, relax, take a camel ride, or visit the beautifully situated Erdene Khambiin Khiid temple.

Kharkhorin & Orkhon River Valley Spend an immersive day exploring the cultural and natural heritage of Kharkhorin and the surrounding Orkhon River Valley—a UNESCO World Heritage site. Highlights include Erdene Zuu Monastery and the Kharkhorin Museum.

Return to Ulaanbaatar Return to Ulaanbaatar and transfer to your chosen accommodation. The afternoon and evening are free — time to rest, wander, or ease back into the city before meeting for Naadam the following morning.ate

Naadam Horse Racing at Khui Doloon Khudag Travel to Khui Doloon Khudag, where the thrilling Naadam horse races take place. Join Mongolians from all walks of life, soaking up the festive holiday atmosphere in the vast steppe setting.

Experience Mongolia's State Naadam Immerse yourself in the colour and spectacle of Mongolia’s State Naadam Festival. Enjoy the traditional “Three Manly Sports” of wrestling, archery, and ankle bone shooting, alongside concerts and the spectacular Opening Ceremony.
